'Perth [Australia] is on track to breaking another weather record as low daytime temperatures continue this week....
So far this month, Perth has had five consecutive days where the overnight temperatures dropped below five degrees, and on every day except one, the maximum had not exceeded 17 degrees.
Yesterday, the Gascoyne Junction recorded its Coldest day in 45 years, with the temperature climbing to a chilly 13 degrees.
Jurien Bay also had its Coldest July day in 39 years, Reaching just 13 degrees yesterday.'Â --Â 11 July 2011Â --Â http://www.watoday.com.au/wa-news/no-surprises-here-perths-on-another-record-Cold-spell-20110711-1ha94.htmlÂ
